<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Peafowl Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=1739) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=152" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 128 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Prerequisites**
[Monastic Weaponry](/Feats.aspx?ID=434)

**Requirements**
You are wielding a sword that has the [monk](/Traits.aspx?ID=112) trait in one hand.

</column>

---

You enter a tall and proud stance while remaining mobile, with all the grace and composure of a peafowl. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are melee Strikes with the required sword. Once per round, after you hit with a monk sword Strike, you can Step as a free action as your next action.

<title level="2">Peafowl Stance leads to...</title>
[Peafowl Strut](/Feats.aspx?ID=1748)
